thread.title: Man fatally struck by train in Harlem subway
thread.title_full: Man fatally struck by train in Harlem subway - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Man fatally struck by train in Harlem subway
text:
A man was struck and killed by a downtown D train in a Harlem subway station on Friday, police said.
The man was walking across the tracks — from the uptown platform to the downtown platform — in the B/D station on 155th St. and Frederick Douglass Blvd. at 11:20 p.m. when he was hit, cops said.
The man, whose name and age were not immediately released, appeared to be homeless, authorities said.
He died in the station.
Man faints, falls onto subway tracks in Manhattan, avoids injury 
Police and MTA employees temporarily shut down service at the stop as they investigated.
In a separate incident in Brooklyn, thirty minutes earlier, a man lost part of his arm after being run over by a B train at the elevated Brighton Beach station.
The man was struck and trapped by the train around 10:50 p.m., officials said. He is expected to survive.
